Uses of Class
gameFiles.Node

Packages that use Node
gameFiles   
 

Uses of Node in gameFiles
 

Methods in gameFiles that return Node
 Node Parcel.getDestination()
          Returns the destination Node for this Parcel
 Node[] Edge.getExits()
          Returns the exits of this road, a length 2 array of Nodes.
 Node Edge.getFirstExit()
          Returns the first exit of this road
 Node Truck.getGoingTo()
          Returns the Truck's eventual destination; the Node this Truck will be at when the current travel queue is empty.
 Node Truck.getLocation()
          Returns the Truck's current location.
 Node Map.getNode(java.lang.String name)
          Returns the Node named name in this map if it exists, null otherwise
 Node Edge.getOther(Node n)
          Returns the other exit that is not equal to Node n.
 Node Map.getRandomNode()
          Returns a random node in this map
 Node Edge.getSecondExit()
          Returns the second exit of this road
 Node Parcel.getStart()
          Returns the start Node for this Parcel
 Node Truck.getTravelingTo()
          Returns the Truck's current destination.
 

Methods in gameFiles that return types with arguments of type Node
 java.util.HashSet<Node> Map.getNodes()
          Returns a HashSet containing all the Nodes in this map.
 

Methods in gameFiles with parameters of type Node
 Edge Node.getConnect(Node other)
          Returns the road that this node shares with node other, or null if not connected
 Node Edge.getOther(Node n)
          Returns the other exit that is not equal to Node n.
 boolean Node.isConnectedTo(Node destination)
          Returns false if destination.equals(this), else Returns true if one of the edges in exits leads to Node destination, false otherwise.
 boolean Edge.isExit(Node node)
          Returns true if Node node is one of the exits of this Edge, false otherwise
